Package io.j4c.config.spi

Interface PollingStrategy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Supplier<PollingStrategy>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EtcdWatchPollingStrategy

    public interface PollingStrategy
extends Supplier<PollingStrategy>
    Polling Strategy SPI allows user to implement own policy for polling ConfigSource(s) to load changed config data.

    PollingStrategy provides a publisher of PollingStrategy.PollingEvents that are fired every time when implementation of PollingStrategy decides. The event can be interpreted as "it is a time to check if the config source has changed".

    PollingStrategy might be specified on every AbstractParsableConfigSource, otherwise the "no op" implementation is used. Custom ConfigSource implementation can also use PollingStrategy SPI. Usually a config source subscribes on publisher and executes reloading of the configuration source content every time the PollingStrategy.PollingEvent is received.

    Configuration sources can be loaded from meta configuration, see ConfigSources.load(Config). It includes also support loading polling strategies from meta configuration. All built-in polling strategies are supported as well as custom implementations of polling strategies. The support is tightly connected with AbstractSource extensions and will not be automatically provided by any another config source implementations. Meta configuration property polling-strategy can be configured using following properties:

    • type - specify type of loaded polling strategy implementation. It can contain identification of one of built-in strategies.
    • class - fully qualified class name of custom polling strategy implementation, or a builder class that has build() method returning PollingStrategy instance.
    • properties - object node of another properties used to initialize appropriate strategy instance from.
    Use exclusively type or class property. If used both, class is ignored. There are following built-in polling strategies, i.e. supported type values:
    • regular - regular scheduled polling strategy, see PollingStrategies.regular(Duration).

      Mandatory properties:

      • interval - type Duration, e.g. PT15S means 15 seconds
    • watch - filesystem watch polling strategy, see PollingStrategies.watch(Path). Polling strategy can be used just with config sources built by AbstractSource.Builder extension parametrized by Path for source target. For example classpath, file or directory config sources. No additional properties are supported.
    See ConfigSource.from(Config) for example of using built-in polling strategies.

    Custom polling strategy is represented by fully qualified class name. ConfigMapper support is used to initialize the class instance. See Config javadoc for details about generic mapping support. Such polling strategy is applied as common polling strategy. In case of target specific implementation of polling strategy (similar to Path specific filesystem watch polling strategy) a implementation class must has public constructor with single parameter of target type.

    See Also:
    AbstractSource.Builder.pollingStrategy(Supplier), Flow.Publisher, PollingStrategies - access built-in implementations.

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  PollingStrategy.PollingEvent
      An event is fired by PollingStrategy to every subscriber listening on polling strategy publisher.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        default PollingStrategy get​()
        Specified by:
        get in interface Supplier<PollingStrategy>

      • ticks

        Flow.Publisher<PollingStrategy.PollingEvent> ticks​()
        Return a Flow.Publisher which fires PollingStrategy.PollingEvent every time when this polling strategy decides.

        Ticks is HOT stream, i.e. events exist and are fired even there is no subscriber. Subscribers usually request just 1 event and whenever the last event is processed another 1 event is requested. It is expected that subscriber can miss some ticks.

        It is up to PollingStrategy implementations which executor is used to process consumers on. But it is recommended to notify subscribers on same thread as polling strategy implementation operates on.

        Returns:
        a publisher of events
